page.title: 05Local Disaster_Summit Tunnel
page.content: It was Thursday 20th December 1984 at about 6.30am when a fully loaded petroleum tanker was{derailed}in the first trans_Pennine tunnel_the Summit Tunnel.All the emergency services were called to help and a centre was set up at Fothergill and Harvey's.There was a great danger of a massive explosion- luckily the trucks just burned.Flames shot about 150ft from the air shafts and the sky was covered in black smoke.Also petroleum from the trucks outside the tunnel leaked into the River Roach adding further danger. These trucks had been brought out by the brave driver and fireman. They put out the fire eventually by pumping foam down the ventilation shafts,and even then it took four days to end the emergency.
